*div1 type="summary"* *p*John P. Sheldon to Austin, Detroit, Mich., November 7, 1832. Ten or twenty families can be made up here for emigration to Texas,*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Detroit*/location_mentioned*,*date_mentioned n="11-07-1832"> Nov. 7, 183*/date_mentioned*2.*/p* *p*Dr Sir,*/p*
*p*The *person_mentioned*Bearer */person_mentioned*of this *person_mentioned*Dr. S. Denton*/person_mentioned* is on a visit to *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*to find a beautiful spot and a congenial atmosphere, on which and in which to spend the remainder of his days with an amiable *person_mentioned*wife */person_mentioned*whose constitution is too slender to bear our northern winds much longer.*/p*
*p*Please direct him in his examination of your delightful *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*, and I will, I trust *date_mentioned n="xx-xx-1833">next year*/date_mentioned*, repay the obligation personally.*/p*
*p*I wrote you, recently, by *person_mentioned*Mr. Colt*/person_mentioned*, therefore will not now trouble you with a long letter.*/p*
*p*There will be no difficulty in making up, even in this distant land, a party of 10 or 20 *person_mentioned*families */person_mentioned*for *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*Forgive me, if I once more request letters from you—they will be absolutely necessary for me, as I am a thousand times questioned about the prospects of *person_mentioned*settlers */person_mentioned*or *person_mentioned*emigrants */person_mentioned*from our *location_mentioned*States*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Jno P Sheldon */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Col. Stephen F Austin*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*/div1*
